Package de.tum.cit.fop.maze

Class Key

java.lang.Object
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.Key
public class Key extends Object
The Key class represents a collectible key in the game. The key has a position, a texture, and can be collected by the player if they are close enough. It also handles rendering the key and checking proximity to the player.

  • Constructor Details

    • Key

      public Key(float x, float y)
      Constructor to initialize the key at a specific position.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the key's position.
      y - The y-coordinate of the key's position.

  • Method Details

    • render

      public void render(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch)
      Renders the key on the screen if it has not been collected.
      Parameters:
      batch - The sprite batch used to draw the key texture.

    • isCollected

      public boolean isCollected()
      Checks if the key has been collected.
      Returns:
      true if the key has been collected, false otherwise.

    • checkProximityToPlayer

      public boolean checkProximityToPlayer(Player player)
      Checks the proximity of the player to the key. If the player is within the proximity range, the key is considered collectible.
      Parameters:
      player - The player object to check proximity against.
      Returns:
      true if the player is close enough to the key, false otherwise.

    • update

      public void update(Player player, HUD hud)
      Updates the key's state by checking if the player is close enough to collect it. If collected, the key is marked as collected and the HUD is updated.
      Parameters:
      player - The player object to check for proximity.
      hud - The HUD object to update when the key is collected.

    • getY

      public float getY()

    • setY

      public void setY(float y)

    • getX

      public float getX()

    • setX

      public void setX(float x)

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Disposes of the resources used by the key, including its texture. This is called to free memory when the key is no longer needed.
